metadata.title: Syntheses, structural diversity, magnetic properties and dye absorption of various Co() MOFs based on a semi-flexible 4-(3,5-dicarboxylatobenzyloxy)benzoic acid

abstracts.value: Five novel Co() metal–organic frameworks (MOFs) constructed from semi-flexible 4-(3,5-dicarboxylatobenzyloxy)benzoic acid (HL), namely {[Co(HL)(4,4′-bidpe)(HO)]·3HO} (), {[Co(L)(4,4′-bibp)(μ-O)]·2HO} (), {[Co(HL)(1,3-bitl)]·(1,4-Diox)} (), [Co(HL)(3,5-bipd)] (), and {[Co(HL)(tib)]·0.5HO·NMP} () (4,4′-bidpe = 4,4′-bis(imidazolyl)diphenyl ether, 4,4′-bibp = 4,4′-bis(imidazol-1-yl)biphenyl, 1,3-bitl = 1,3-bis(1-imidazoly)toluene, 3,5-bipd = 3,5-bis(1-imidazoly)pyridine, and tib = 1,3,5-tris(1-imidazolyl)benzene), were synthesized under solvothermal conditions and further characterized by elemental analysis, IR spectra, powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD), thermogravimetric (TG) analysis and single-crystal X-ray diffraction. Different architectural topologies have been generated by adjusting the N-donor ligands. Single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis reveals that complex  shows a rare 1D → 2D polyrotaxane network. Complex  possesses an unprecedented 2-nodal (3,10)-connected 3D framework with a Schläfli symbol of (4)(4·6·8)(4). When the 2-connected points (HL and 1,3-bitl ligands) are not calculated, complex  shows a  uninodal 3-connected 2D network with the Schläfli symbol (6), which further constructs a 3D supramolecular structure through O–H⋯O hydrogen bonds; while the 2-connected points are taken into account, complex  exhibits an unprecedented 3-nodal (2,2,4)-connected network. Complex  presents an unprecedented 2-nodal (3,5)-connected 3D framework with a (4·6)(4·6·8) topology, while complex  exhibits another unprecedented 2-nodal (3,5)-connected 2D framework with a (4·6·8)(4·6) Schläfli symbol and shows 2D → 3D supramolecular structure through O–H⋯O hydrogen bonds. Meanwhile, the magnetic properties of complexes  and  are discussed. Moreover, the dye adsorption and mechanism studies indicate that the pore size, the uncoordinated O atoms in carboxyl groups and the uncoordinated carboxyl groups of the MOFs have significant effects on the dye adsorption capacity.

fundingOrganization.title: National Natural Science Foundation of China
